abstract.p: Ray Gillette, Patrice Dermody and Kathie McKirdy are named to new positions at Chicago office of DDB Worldwide as part of series of changes meant to identify the next generation of top leaders (S)

block.p: The Chicago office of DDB Worldwide, part of the Omnicom Group, is reorganizing management in a series of changes meant to identify the next generation of top leaders.
Ray Gillette, 51, president for integrated services, was named president for agency operations, succeeding Dick Rogers, who in March was named president for the DDB United States operations.
The Chicago office of DDB Worldwide, part of the Omnicom Group, is reorganizing management in a series of changes meant to identify the next generation of top leaders.
Ray Gillette, 51, president for integrated services, was named president for agency operations, succeeding Dick Rogers, who in March was named president for the DDB United States operations.

Also, Patrice Dermody, 41, media director, was named to the additional post of president at a new integrated ventures group that will initially comprise three units -- Beyond DDB, @DDB and DDB Corbett -- and will work toward integrating the DDB new-media and technology units into the current operations.
And Kathie McKirdy, 52, director for client services administration, was named to the additional new post of managing director.
